category: Personnel, management and administration procedures; Operations and service delivery
name: Ambiguity of understandability definition
description: Repository is unable to describe what understandability means with reference to their stakeholder communities’ expectations or requirements.
notes:
- Does the repository define understandability with respect to its user communities’ expectations and requirements? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes: - Repository preserves information and associated metadata based on a perception of what is required by user communities that is not necessarily representative
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Define and regularly review the concept of understandability with respect to community’s expectations, requirements and knowledge base
- Make understandability definition available to community and solicit their feedback In the event of risk’s execution:
- Retrospectively introduce policy detailing understandability definition
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
